intro: Anchusa undulata var. pseudogranatensis, commonly known as the Spanish catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
